com.igormaznitsa.prol.data
Class Var

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.data.Term
      com.igormaznitsa.prol.data.Var

public final class Var
extends Term

The class contains the prolog var implementation, very important class for engine work. A variable can contain another variable as a value and in the case we will have a variable chain. There is a protection mechanism to avoid the link to itself but a user can to set values directly and in the case it should be careful.

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)
See Also:
Term

getValue

public final Term getValue()
Get the value of the variable, if the variable has an other variable as its value, the function will find walue recursively

Returns:
the value of the variable if it is instantiated and null if it is not instantiated

setValue

public final boolean setValue(Term value)
Set the value for the variable, if the value is a variable then the term will be tried to be set to the child variable.

Parameters:
value - the value for the variable as a Term object
Returns:
true if the variable can be instantiated by the value or false if it can't

Equ

public boolean Equ(Term atom)
Description copied from class: Term
Check that the term is equal to an other term. Variables in the terms will be changed in the operation.

Overrides:
Equ in class Term
Parameters:
atom - the other term to be compared, must not be null
Returns:
true if both term are equal, else false (but terms can be changed after the operation)

termComparsion

public int termComparsion(Term atom)
Description copied from class: Term
To compare two terms, it is like prolog predicate '==' or '=\='

Overrides:
termComparsion in class Term
Returns:
0 if both term are equal, -1 if compared term has bigger order and 1 if compared term has lower order
